title: Handwriting font in former issues of POPmagazine
content:
Hey guys, they changed the look and feel of POP some time ago, but this handwritten / painted font is quite good, any idea what it is?

[Example of cover](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201165039/http:/upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/7/71/N1427370084_30001613_5084.jpg)

 [‹ menchie's font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201165039/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49911 "Go to previous forum topic") [Sing, yo! (This is probably a stumper) ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201165039/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49897 "Go to next forum topic")
author: iconique

comments.content:
Two different capital A’s.  
Seven different lower case s’s, including what could be two different double-s ligatures.

I’d be very surprised (and impressed) if this is a font.

Yer, it looks like being actually painted because it **is** painted.  
It’s not a font.

In that case they made a lot of effort since they used this typography for several issues both on the cover and inside... maybe a custom set of fonts or they scanned it... hence why it looks so nice and random... maybe somebody else has a suggestion on something similar?
I don’t think it’s a custom font either, Pop really uses a lot of hand lettering. The cover lines and headlines are also all hand lettered in their current F/W 08 issue, albeit in a different style.

Another suggestion for a font if you don’t want to use hand lettering could be [Lucrecia](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201165039/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/andinistas/lucrecia/) which comes with varying degrees of grunginess. It is somewhat scripty, unlike many other grunge-brush styles.

- Mike Yanega
